text: John Hammond, D.D (1640-1723) was a priest in England during the late 17th and early 18th centuries."Catalogue of the Lansdowne Manuscripts in the British Museum" p241: London; British Museum ; 1819 Hammond was educated at was educated at Christ Church, Oxford. Alumni Oxonienses 1500-1714, Haak-Harman He was Chaplain to Dr. William Fuller, Bishop of Lincoln; Rector of Chalfont St Giles, a Canon of Lincoln and Archdeacon of Huntingdon from 1673 to 1701. He died on 25 May 1723. ==Notes== Category:Alumni of Christ Church, Oxford Category:17th-century English Anglican priests Category:18th-century English Anglican priests Category:Archdeacons of Huntingdon Category:1640 births Category:1723 deaths
title: John Hammond (priest)
